About

Who am I?

I am a senior year undergrad student at University of Mumbai majoring in Computer Engineering.

I’ve been working with Dr. Zeerak Talat from the Digital Democracies Institute at Simon Fraser University for cross-dataset generalization in hate speech detection. We have also worked on emoji prediction in low resource languages.

I’m also a part of Unicode Research Group led by Swapneel Mehta (NYU CSMaP) and mentored by Dr. Akash Srivastava (MIT-IBM Lab) where we’re currently working on identifying mentorship effects in Indian institutions using Causal Inference. We have also recently started working on a simulator to model online communities in order to measure polarization on social networks.

My current areas of interest include:

  • Natural Language Processing
  • Computational Social Science
  • Information Retrieval
  • Social Networks

I was a Teaching Assistant for the Unicode Machine Learning Summer Course 2021 supported by Google Research India.

In the past, I’ve worked as a Summer Intern in the Corporate and Investment Banking Department at JPMorgan Chase & Co. Before that, I was a Freelance Python Developer at Margosatree Technologies . I’ve also worked as a Machine Learning Engineer Intern at Levyne and as a Data Analyst at Feople.

Apart from coding, I spend my leisure time swimming, reading books, solving riddles and exploring some amazing offbeat places.

Where can you find me?

  • Github
  • LinkedIn
  • Google Scholar
  • ORCiD
